data.Sentence_cn: 课文42  记录地震
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 42 Recording an earthquake

data.Sentence_cn: 笔要做什么才能把地震产生的震动记录在纸上?
data.Sentence: What does a pen have to do to record on paper the vibrations generated by an earthquake?

data.Sentence_cn: 地震就像夜间的小偷，不打招呼就来了。
data.Sentence: An earthquake comes like a thief in the night, without warning.

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，有必要发明一种仪器，既不打盹儿，也不睡觉。
data.Sentence: It was necessary, therefore, to invent instruments that neither slumbered nor slept.

data.Sentence_cn: 有些装置非常简单。
data.Sentence: Some devices were quite simple.

data.Sentence_cn: 例如，有一种装置是由一些长短、粗细不同的木棒组成，就像九柱戏的木棒一样坚立着，
data.Sentence: One, for instance, consisted of rods of various lengths and thicknesses which would stand up on end like ninepins.

data.Sentence_cn: 一旦有地震，就会震动竖立在坚硬的桌上的木棒。
data.Sentence: When a shock came, it shook the rigid table upon which these stood.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果地震轻微，只有不稳定的木棒倒下；
data.Sentence: If it were gentle, only the more unstable rods fell.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果地震剧烈，所有的木棒都会例下。
data.Sentence: If it were severe, they all fell.

data.Sentence_cn: 木棒倒下的多少和倒下的方向就为科学家记录下了地震的强度，
data.Sentence: Thus the rods, by falling, and by the direction in which they fell,

data.Sentence_cn: 由于地震太弱而未惊醒科学家时，
data.Sentence: recorded for the slumbering scientist the strength of a shock that was too weak to waken him,

data.Sentence_cn: 同时还能记录地震方向。
data.Sentence: and the direction from which it came.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，如果要取得真正重大的进展，需要有比这种装置精细得多的仪器。
data.Sentence: But instruments far more delicate than that were needed if any really serious advance was to be made.

data.Sentence_cn: 理想的目标是设计出这样一种仪器：当地震发生时，
data.Sentence: The ideal to be aimed at was to devise an instrument that could record with a pen on paper,

data.Sentence_cn: 它能用笔在纸上记录下大地和桌子运动情况。
data.Sentence: the movements of the ground or of the table as the quake passed by.

data.Sentence_cn: 我写字时，笔是移动的，纸是静止的。
data.Sentence: While I write my pen moves, but the paper keeps still.

data.Sentence_cn: 毫无疑问，经过练习，我最终能够学会笔不动而纸动来写字。
data.Sentence: With practice, no doubt, I could in time learn to write by holding the pen still while the paper moved.

data.Sentence_cn: 这听起来似乎是一种愚蠢的想法，
data.Sentence: That sounds a silly suggestion,

data.Sentence_cn: 但是早期记录地震波的仪器（地震仪）正是采用了这中思路。
data.Sentence: but that was precisely the idea adopted in some of the early instruments (seismometers) for recording earthquake waves.

data.Sentence_cn: 可是，当桌子、夹笔装置、纸都在移动时，怎么能书写得清楚呢？
data.Sentence: But when table, penholder and paper are all moving, how is it possible to write legibly?

data.Sentence_cn: 可以从我们的日常生活观察中找到这个问题的答案。
data.Sentence: The key to a solution of that problem lay in an everyday observation.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个人站在公共汽车或火车上，当车突然开动时，他为什么会倾倒呢？
data.Sentence: Why does a person standing in a bus or train tend to fall when a sudden start is made?

data.Sentence_cn: 这是因为他的脚动了，而他的头保持着静止。
data.Sentence: It is because his feet move on, but his head stays still.

data.Sentence_cn: 再做一个简单的实验可以帮助我们进一步理解这个问题。
data.Sentence: A simple experiment will help us a little further.

data.Sentence_cn: 把一个重物拴在一根长绳子的一端，
data.Sentence: Tie a heavy weight at the end of a long piece of string.

data.Sentence_cn: 把手高高举在空中握住绳子，让重物几乎接触地面。
data.Sentence: With the hand held high in the air, hold the string so that the weight nearly touches the ground.

data.Sentence_cn: 然后把手前后左右以及旋转摆动，但不要上下摆动。
data.Sentence: Now move the hand to and fro and around but not up and down.

data.Sentence_cn: 结果会发现，重物是动了，但动得很小，甚至没动。
data.Sentence: It will be found that the weight moves but slightly or not at all.

data.Sentence_cn: 假定把一支笔拴在重物上，笔尖落在地板上的一张纸上。
data.Sentence: Imagine a pen attached to the weight in such a way that its point rests upon a piece of paper on the floor.

data.Sentence_cn: 假定地震发生了，地板、纸、你和你的手都会动，
data.Sentence: Imagine an earthquake shock shaking the floor, the paper, you and your hand.

data.Sentence_cn: 在这些所有的运动中，重物和笔却不动。
data.Sentence: In the midst of all this movement, the weight and the pen would be still.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于纸在笔下来回运动，纸的表面就会用墨水记录下地板运动的情况。
data.Sentence: But as the paper moved from side to side under the pen point, its movement would be recorded in ink upon its surface.

data.Sentence_cn: 根据这一原理，制造出了最初的地震仪器，但是纸是卷在慢慢放置的圆筒上的。
data.Sentence: It was upon this principle that the first instruments were made, but the paper was wrapped round a drum which rotated slowly.

data.Sentence_cn: 只要一切都是静止的，笔就会划出一条直线；
data.Sentence: As long as all was still, the pen drew a straight line,

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，圆筒受到震动，笔所画出的线就会就会左右摆动。
data.Sentence: but while the drum was being shaken, the line that the pen was drawing wriggled from side to side.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而，这里所说的仪器
data.Sentence: The apparatus thus described, however,

data.Sentence_cn: 记录下来的只是地震波运动中的水平部分，地震波的运动实际比这要复杂得多。
data.Sentence: records only the horizontal component of the wave movement, which is, in fact, much more complicated.

data.Sentence_cn: 假如我们真能看到运动轨迹，
data.Sentence: If we could actually see the path described by a particle,

data.Sentence_cn: 诸如岩石中的一个沙粒子，
data.Sentence: such as a sand grain in the rock,

data.Sentence_cn: 那就像一只嗡嗡叫的绿头苍蝇在屋内飞行的轨迹，呈现出上上下下、来来回回、左左右右3种性质的运动。
data.Sentence: it would be more like that of a bluebottle buzzing round the room; it would be up and down, to and fro and from side to side.

data.Sentence_cn: 经设计出了一些仪器，它按照一定的安放方式就可测绘出这三种运动的曲线图。
data.Sentence: Instruments have been devised and can be so placed that all three elements can be recorded in different graphs.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果把这种仪器安装在距震源700多英里远的地方，
data.Sentence: When the instrument is situated at more than 700 miles from the earthquake centre,

data.Sentence_cn: 曲线记录就能显示出前后相同的这3种地震波。
data.Sentence: the graphic record shows three waves arriving one after the other at short intervals.

data.Sentence_cn: 首先记录下的是纵向波的到达；
data.Sentence: The first records the arrival of longitudinal vibrations.

data.Sentence_cn: 然后记录下的是横向波的到达，横向波比纵向波传播得慢，在纵向波到过几分钟后能到达。
data.Sentence: The second marks the arrival of transverse vibrations which travel more slowly and arrive several minutes after the first.

data.Sentence_cn: 这两种波都是穿过地球而来的。
data.Sentence: These two have travelled through the earth.

data.Sentence_cn: 正是从这两种波中的研究中，我们可以了解到地球内部的许多情况。
data.Sentence: It was from the study of these that so much was learnt about the interior of the earth.

data.Sentence_cn: 第三种波，即主波，是最慢的，是围绕地球通过表面岩石传来的。
data.Sentence: The third, or main wave is the slowest and has travelled round the earth through the surface rocks.
